result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:12 AM cases 22CM34, 22CT83 called. Defendant Robert J. Wilson in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Robert J. Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Count 2 in 22CM34 is amended to a county ordinance for Possession of THC on the State's motion. Defense enters a no contest plea to the amended count and 22TR1458. Court accepts pleas. Anything else is dismissed and read in. Court orders forfeitures on both counts.
